Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 001 1410 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 1410 : 2 Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars. 1410 : 3 First Mehl: 1410 : 4 O you with swollen breasts, let your consciousness become deep and profound. 1410 : 5 O mother−in−law, how can I bow? Because of my stiff nipples, I cannot bow. 1410 : 6 O sister, those mansions built as high as mountains 1410 : 7 − I have seen them come crumbling down. O bride, do not be so proud of your nipples. ||1|| 1410 : 8 O bride with deer−like eyes, listen to the words of deep and infinite wisdom. 1410 : 9 First, examine the merchandise, and then, make the deal. 2

1410 : 10 Proclaim that you will not associate with evil people; celebrate victory with your friends. 1410 : 11 This proclamation, to meet with your friends, O bride − give it some thought. 1410 : 12 Surrender mind and body to the Lord your Friend; this is the most excellent pleasure. 1410 : 13 Do not fall in love with one who is destined to leave. 1410 : 14 O Nanak, I am a sacrifice to those who understand this. ||2|| 1410 : 15 If you wish to swim across the water, then consult those who know how to swim. 1410 : 16 Those who have survived these treacherous waves are very wise. ||3|| 1410 : 17 The storm rages and the rain floods the land; thousands of waves rise and surge. 1410 : 18 If you cry out for help from the True Guru, you have nothing to fear − your boat will not sink. ||4|| 1410 : 19 O Nanak, what has happened to the world? Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 001 3

1410 : 20 There is no guide or friend. 1410 : 21 There is no love, even among brothers and relatives. 1410 : 22 For the sake of the world, people have lost their faith. ||5|| 1410 : 23 They cry and weep and wail. 1410 : 24 They slap their faces and pull their hair out. 1410 : 25 But if they chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord, they shall be absorbed into it. 1410 : 26 O Nanak, I am a sacrifice to them. ||6|| 1410 : 27 O my mind, do not waver or walk on the crooked path; take the straight and true path. 1410 : 28 The terrible tiger is behind you, and the pool of fire is ahead. 1410 : 29 My soul is skeptical and doubtful, but I cannot see any other way to go. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 001 4

1410 : 30 O Nanak, as Gurmukh, dwell with your Beloved Lord, and you shall be saved. ||7|| 1410 : 31 The tiger is killed, and the mind is killed, through the Teachings of the True Guru. 1410 : 32 One who understands himself, meets with the Lord, and never dies again. −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 001 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 001 5

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 002 1411 : 33 One who sees the One and Only Lord with his eyes − his hands shall not get muddy and dirty. 1411 : 34 O Nanak, the Gurmukhs are saved; the Guru has surrounded the ocean with the embankment of Truth. ||8|| 1411 : 35 If you wish to put out the fire, then look for water; without the Guru, the ocean of water is not found. 1411 : 36 You shall continue to wander lost in reincarnation through birth and death, even if you do thousands of other deeds. 1411 : 37 But you shall not be taxed by the Messenger of Death, if you walk in harmony with the Will of the True Guru. 1411 : 38 O Nanak, the immaculate, immortal status is obtained, and the Guru will unite you in the Lord's Union. ||9|| 1411 : 39 The crow rubs and washes itself in the mud puddle. 1411 : 40 Its mind and body are polluted with its own mistakes and demerits, and its beak is filled with dirt. 6

1411 : 41 The swan in the pool associated with the crow, not knowing that it was evil. 1411 : 42 Such is the love of the faithless cynic; understand this, O spiritually wise ones, through love and devotion. 1411 : 43 So proclaim the victory of the Society of the Saints, and act as Gurmukh. 1411 : 44 Immaculate and pure is that cleansing bath, O Nanak, at the sacred shrine of the Guru's river. ||10|| 1411 : 45 What should I account as the rewards of this human life, if one does not feel love and devotion to the Lord? 1411 : 46 Wearing clothes and eating food is useless, if the mind is filled with the love of duality. 1411 : 47 Seeing and hearing is false, if one speaks lies. 1411 : 48 O Nanak, praise the Naam, the Name of the Lord; everything else is coming and going in egotism. ||11|| 1411 : 49 The Saints are few and far between; everything else in the world is just a pompous show. ||12|| Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 002 7

1411 : 50 O Nanak, one who is struck by the Lord dies instantaneously; the power to live is lost. 1411 : 51 If someone dies by such a stroke, then he is accepted. 1411 : 52 He alone is struck, who is struck by the Lord; after such a stroke, he is approved. 1411 : 53 The arrow of love, shot by the All−knowing Lord, cannot be pulled out. ||13|| 1411 : 54 Who can wash the unbaked clay pot? 1411 : 55 Joining the five elements together, the Lord made a false cover. 1411 : 56 When it pleases Him, He makes it right. 1411 : 57 The supreme light shines forth, and the celestial song vibrates and resounds. ||14|| 1411 : 58 Those who are totally blind in their minds, do not have the integrity to keep their word. 1411 : 59 With their blind minds, and their upside−down heart−lotus, they look totally ugly. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 002 8

1411 : 60 Some know how to speak and understand what they are told. Those people are wise and good−looking. 1411 : 61 Some do not know the Sound−current of the Naad, spiritual wisdom or the joy of song. They do not even understand good and bad. 1411 : 62 Some have no idea of perfection, wisdom or understanding; they know nothing about the mystery of the Word. 1411 : 63 O Nanak, those people are really donkeys; they have no virtue or merit, but still, they are very proud. ||15|| 1411 : 64 He alone is a Brahmin, who knows God. 1411 : 65 He chants and meditates, and practices austerity and good deeds. 1411 : 66 He keeps to the Dharma, with faith, humility and contentment. 1411 : 67 Breaking his bonds, he is liberated. 1411 : 68 Such a Brahmin is worthy of being worshipped. ||16|| Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 002 9

1411 : 69 He alone is a Kh'shaatriyaa, who is a hero in good deeds. 1411 : 70 He uses his body to give in charity; 1411 : 71 he understands his farm, and plants the seeds of generosity. 1411 : 72 Such a Kh'shaatriyaa is accepted in the Court of the Lord. 1411 : 73 Whoever practices greed, possessiveness and falsehood, 1411 : 74 shall receive the fruits of his own labors. ||17|| 1411 : 75 Do not heat your body like a furnace, or burn your bones like firewood. 1411 : 76 What have your head and feet done wrong? See your Husband Lord within yourself. ||18|| −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 002 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 002 10

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 003 1412 : 77 God the Cosmic Husband dwells within all hearts; without Him, there is no heart at all. 1412 : 78 O Nanak, the Gurmukhs are the happy, virtuous soul−brides; the Lord is revealed to them. ||19|| 1412 : 79 If you desire to play this game of love with Me, 1412 : 80 then step onto My Path with your head in hand. 1412 : 81 When you place your feet on this Path, 1412 : 82 give Me your head, and do not pay any attention to public opinion. ||20|| 1412 : 83 False is friendship with the false and greedy. False is its foundation. 1412 : 84 O Moollah, no one knows where death shall strike. ||21|| 1412 : 85 Without spiritual wisdom, the people worship ignorance. 11

1412 : 86 They grope in the darkness, in the love of duality. ||22|| 1412 : 87 Without the Guru, there is no spiritual wisdom; without Dharma, there is no meditation. 1412 : 88 Without Truth, there is no credit; without capital, there is no balance. ||23|| 1412 : 89 The mortals are sent into the world; then, they arise and depart. 1412 : 90 There is no joy in this. ||24|| 1412 : 91 Raam Chand, sad at heart, assembled his army and forces. 1412 : 92 The army of monkeys was at his service; his mind and body became eager for war. 1412 : 93 Raawan captured his wife Sita, and Lachhman was cursed to die. 1412 : 94 O Nanak, the Creator Lord is the Doer of all; He watches over all, and destroys what He has created. ||25|| 1412 : 95 In his mind, Raam Chand mourned for Sita and Lachhman. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 003 12

1412 : 96 Then, he remembered Hanuman the monkey−god, who came to him. 1412 : 97 The misguided demon did not understand that God is the Doer of deeds. 1412 : 98 O Nanak, the actions of the Self−existent Lord cannot be erased. ||26|| 1412 : 99 The city of Lahore suffered terrible destruction for four hours. ||27|| 1412 : 100 Third Mehl: 1412 : 101 The city of Lahore is a pool of ambrosial nectar, the home of praise. ||28|| 1412 : 102 First Mehl: 1412 : 103 What are the signs of a prosperous person? His stores of food never run out. 1412 : 104 Prosperity dwells in his home, with the sounds of girls and women. 1412 : 105 All the women of his home shout and cry over useless things. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 003 13

1412 : 106 Whatever he takes, he does not give back. Seeking to earn more and more, he is troubled and uneasy. ||29|| 1412 : 107 O lotus, your leaves were green, and your blossoms were gold. 1412 : 108 What pain has burnt you, and made your body black? O Nanak, my body is battered. 1412 : 109 I have not received that water which I love. 1412 : 110 Seeing it, my body blossomed forth, and I was blessed with a deep and beautiful color. ||30|| 1412 : 111 No one lives long enough to accomplish all he wishes. 1412 : 112 Only the spiritually wise live forever; they are honored for their intuitive awareness. 1412 : 113 Bit by bit, life passes away, even though the mortal tries to hold it back. 1412 : 114 O Nanak, unto whom should we complain? Death takes one's life away without anyone's consent. ||31|| 1412 : 115 Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 003 14

Do not blame the Sovereign Lord; when someone grows old, his intellect leaves him. 1412 : 116 The blind man talks and babbles, and then falls into the ditch. ||32|| 1412 : 117 All that the Perfect Lord does is perfect; there is not too little, or too much. 1412 : 118 O Nanak, knowing this as Gurmukh, the mortal merges into the Perfect Lord God. ||33|| −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 003 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 003 15

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 004 1413 : 119 Shalok, Third Mehl: 1413 : 120 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1413 : 121 Do not call the wandering beggars holy men, if their minds are filled with doubt. 1413 : 122 Whoever gives to them, O Nanak, earns the same sort of merit. ||1|| 1413 : 123 One who begs for the supreme status of the Fearless and Immaculate Lord 1413 : 124 − how rare are those who have the opportunity, O Nanak, to give food to such a person. ||2|| 1413 : 125 If I were a religious scholar, an astrologer, or one who could recite the four Vedas, 1413 : 126 I could be famous throughout the nine regions of the earth, for my wisdom and thoughtful contemplation. ||3|| 1413 : 127 If a Brahmin kills a cow or a female infant, and accepts the offerings of an evil person, 16

1413 : 128 he is cursed with the leprosy of curses and criticism; he is forever and ever filled with egotistical pride. 1413 : 129 One who forgets the Naam, O Nanak, is covered by countless sins. 1413 : 130 Let all wisdom be burnt away, except for the essence of spiritual wisdom. ||4|| 1413 : 131 No one can erase that primal destiny written upon one's forehead. 1413 : 132 O Nanak, whatever is written there, comes to pass. He alone understands, who is blessed by God's Grace. ||5|| 1413 : 133 Those who forget the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and become attached to greed and fraud, 1413 : 134 are engrossed in the entanglements of Maya the enticer, with the fire of desire within them. 1413 : 135 Those who, like the pumpkin vine, are too stubborn climb the trellis, are cheated by Maya the cheater. 1413 : 136 The self−willed manmukhs are bound and gagged and led away; the dogs do not join the herd of cows. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 004 17

1413 : 137 The Lord Himself misleads the misguided ones, and He Himself unites them in His Union. 1413 : 138 O Nanak, the Gurmukhs are saved; they walk in harmony with the Will of the True Guru. ||6|| 1413 : 139 I praise the Praiseworthy Lord, and sing the Praises of the True Lord. 1413 : 140 O Nanak, the One Lord alone is True; stay away from all other doors. ||7|| 1413 : 141 O Nanak, wherever I go, I find the True Lord. 1413 : 142 Wherever I look, I see the One Lord. He reveals Himself to the Gurmukh. ||8|| 1413 : 143 The Word of the Shabad is the Dispeller of sorrow, if one enshrines it in the mind. 1413 : 144 By Guru's Grace, it dwells in the mind; by God's Mercy, it is obtained. ||9|| 1413 : 145 O Nanak, acting in egotism, countless thousands have wasted away to death. 1413 : 146 Those who meet with the True Guru are saved, through the Shabad, the True Word of the Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 004 18

Inscrutable Lord. ||10|| 1413 : 147 Those who serve the True Guru single−mindedly − I fall at the feet of those humble beings. 1413 : 148 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the Lord abides in the mind, and the hunger for Maya departs. 1413 : 149 Immaculate and pure are those humble beings, who, as Gurmukh, merge in the Naam. 1413 : 150 O Nanak, other empires are false; they alone are true emperors, who are imbued with the Naam. ||11|| 1413 : 151 The devoted wife in her husband's home has a great longing to perform loving devotional service to him; 1413 : 152 she prepares and offers to him all sorts of sweet delicacies and dishes of all flavors. 1413 : 153 In the same way, the devotees praise the Word of the Guru's Bani, and focus their consciousness on the Lord's Name. 1413 : 154 They place mind, body and wealth in offering before the Guru, and sell their heads to Him. 1413 : 155 Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 004 19

In the Fear of God, His devotees yearn for His devotional worship; God fulfills their desires, and merges them with Himself. −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 004 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 004 20

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 005 1414 : 156 My Lord God is Self−existent and Independent. What does He need to eat to be satisfied? 1414 : 157 Whoever walks in harmony with the Will of the True Guru, and sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord, is pleasing to Him. 1414 : 158 Blessed, blessed are they, in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, O Nanak, who walk in harmony with the Will of the True Guru. ||12|| 1414 : 159 Those who do not serve the True Guru, and do not keep the Shabad enshrined in their hearts 1414 : 160 − cursed are their lives. Why did they even come into the world? 1414 : 161 If one follows the Guru's Teachings, and keeps the Fear of God in his mind, then he is lovingly attuned to the sublime essence of the Lord. 1414 : 162 By his primal destiny, he obtains the Name; O Nanak, he is carried across. ||13|| 1414 : 163 The world wanders lost in emotional attachment to Maya; it does not realize that its own home is being plundered. 21

1414 : 164 The self−willed manmukh is blind in the world; his mind is lured away by sexual desire and anger. 1414 : 165 With the sword of spiritual wisdom, kill the five demons. Remain awake and aware to the Guru's Teachings. 1414 : 166 The Jewel of the Naam is revealed, and the mind and body are purified. 1414 : 167 Those who lack the Naam wander around lost, with their noses cut off; without the Name, they sit and cry. 1414 : 168 O Nanak, no one can erase that which is pre−ordained by the Creator Lord. ||14|| 1414 : 169 The Gurmukhs earn the wealth of the Lord, contemplating the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 1414 : 170 They receive the wealth of the Naam; their treasures are overflowing. 1414 : 171 Through the Word of the Guru's Bani, they utter the Glorious Praises of the Lord, whose end and limitations cannot be found. 1414 : 172 O Nanak, the Creator is the Doer of all; the Creator Lord beholds all. ||15|| Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 005 22

1414 : 173 Within the Gurmukh is intuitive peace and poise; his mind ascends to the Tenth Plane of the Akaashic Ethers. 1414 : 174 No one is sleepy or hungry there; they dwell in the peace of the Ambrosial Name of the Lord. 1414 : 175 O Nanak, pain and pleasure do not afflict anyone, where the Light of the Lord, the Supreme Soul, illuminates. ||16|| 1414 : 176 All have come, wearing the robes of sexual desire and anger. 1414 : 177 Some are born, and some pass away. They come and go according to the Hukam of the Lord's Command. 1414 : 178 Their comings and goings in reincarnation do not end; they are imbued with the love of duality. 1414 : 179 Bound in bondage, they are made to wander, and they cannot do anything about it. ||17|| 1414 : 180 Those, upon whom the Lord showers His Mercy, come and meet the True Guru. 1414 : 181 Meeting with the True Guru, they turn away from the world; they remain dead while still alive, with intuitive peace and poise. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 005 23

1414 : 182 O Nanak, the devotees are imbued with the Lord; they are absorbed in the Name of the Lord. ||18|| 1414 : 183 The intellect of the self−willed manmukh is fickle; he is very tricky and clever within. 1414 : 184 Whatever he has done, and all that he does, is useless. Not even an iota of it is acceptable. 1414 : 185 The charity and generosity he pretends to give will be judged by the Righteous Judge of Dharma. 1414 : 186 Without the True Guru, the Messenger of Death does not leave the mortal alone; he is ruined by the love of duality. 1414 : 187 Youth slips away imperceptibly, old age comes, and then he dies. 1414 : 188 The mortal is caught in love and emotional attachment to children and spouse, but none of them will be his helper and support in the end. 1414 : 189 Whoever serves the True Guru finds peace; the Name comes to abide in the mind. 1414 : 190 O Nanak, great and very fortunate are those who, as Gurmukh, are absorbed in the Naam. ||19|| Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 005 24
1414 : 191 The self−willed manmukhs do not even think of the Name; without the Name, they cry in pain. −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 005 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 005 25

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 006 1415 : 192 They do not worship the Lord, the Supreme Soul; how can they find peace in duality? 1415 : 193 They are filled with the filth of egotism; they do not wash it away with the Word of the Shabad. 1415 : 194 O Nanak, without the Name, they die in their filth; they waste the priceless opportunity of this human life. ||20|| 1415 : 195 The self−willed manmukhs are deaf and blind; they are filled with the fire of desire. 1415 : 196 They have no intuitive understanding of the Guru's Bani; they are not illumined with the Shabad. 1415 : 197 They do not know their own inner being, and they have no faith in the Guru's Word. 1415 : 198 The Word of the Guru's Shabad is within the being of the spiritually wise ones. They always blossom in His love. 1415 : 199 The Lord saves the honor of the spiritually wise ones.I am forever a sacrifice to them. 1415 : 200 26

Servant Nanak is the slave of those Gurmukhs who serve the Lord. ||21|| 1415 : 201 The poisonous snake, the serpent of Maya, has surrounded the world with its coils, O mother! 1415 : 202 The antidote to this poisonous venom is the Name of the Lord; the Guru places the magic spell of the Shabad into the mouth. 1415 : 203 Those who are blessed with such pre−ordained destiny come and meet the True Guru. 1415 : 204 Meeting with the True Guru, they become immaculate, and the poison of egotism is eradicated. 1415 : 205 Radiant and bright are the faces of the Gurmukhs; they are honored in the Court of the Lord. 1415 : 206 Servant Nanak is forever a sacrifice to those who walk in harmony with the Will of the True Guru. ||22|| 1415 : 207 The True Guru, the Primal Being, has no hatred or vengeance. His heart is constantly attuned to the Lord. 1415 : 208 Whoever directs hatred against the Guru, who has no hatred at all, only sets his own home on fire. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 006 27

1415 : 209 Anger and egotism are within him night and day; he burns, and suffers constant pain. 1415 : 210 They babble and tell lies, and keep on barking, eating the poison of the love of duality. 1415 : 211 For the sake of the poison of Maya, they wander from house to house, and lose their honor. 1415 : 212 They are like the son of a prostitute, who does not know the name of his father. 1415 : 213 They do not remember the Name of the Lord, Har, Har; the Creator Himself brings them to ruin. 1415 : 214 The Lord showers His Mercy upon the Gurmukhs, and reunites the separated ones with Himself. 1415 : 215 Servant Nanak is a sacrifice to those who fall at the Feet of the True Guru. ||23|| 1415 : 216 Those who are attached to the Naam, the Name of the Lord, are saved; without the Name, they must go to the City of Death. 1415 : 217 O Nanak, without the Name, they find no peace; they come and go in reincarnation with regrets. ||24|| Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 006 28

1415 : 218 When anxiety and wanderings come to an end, the mind becomes happy. 1415 : 219 By Guru's Grace, the soul−bride understands, and then she sleeps without worry. 1415 : 220 Those who have such pre−ordained destiny meet with the Guru, the Lord of the Universe. 1415 : 221 O Nanak, they merge intuitively into the Lord, the Embodiment of Supreme Bliss. ||25|| 1415 : 222 Those who serve their True Guru, who contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad, 1415 : 223 who honor and obey the Will of the True Guru, who keep the Lord's Name enshrined within their hearts, 1415 : 224 are honored, here and hereafter; they are dedicated to the business of the Lord's Name. 1415 : 225 Through the Word of the Shabad, the Gurmukhs gain recognition in that Court of the True Lord. 1415 : 226 The True Name is their merchandise, the True Name is their expenditure; the Love of their Beloved fills their inner beings. 1415 : 227 Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 006 29
The Messenger of Death does not even approach them; the Creator Lord Himself forgives them. −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 006 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 006 30

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 007 1416 : 228 O Nanak, they alone are wealthy, who are imbued with the Naam; the rest of the world is poor. ||26|| 1416 : 229 The Lord's Name is the Support of the Lord's humble servants. Without the Lord's Name, the there is no other place, no place of rest. 1416 : 230 Following the Guru's Teachings, the Name abides in the mind, and one is intuitively, automatically absorbed in the Lord. 1416 : 231 Those with great good fortune meditate on the Naam; night and day, they embrace love for the Name. 1416 : 232 Servant Nanak begs for the dust of their feet; I am forever a sacrifice to them. ||27|| 1416 : 233 The 8.4 million species of beings burn in desire and cry in pain. 1416 : 234 All this show of emotional attachment to Maya shall not go with you at that very last instant. 1416 : 235 Without the Lord, peace and tranquility do not come; unto whom should we go and complain? 31

1416 : 236 By great good fortune, one meets the True Guru, and comes to understand the contemplation of God. 1416 : 237 The fire of desire is totally extinguished, O servant Nanak, enshrining the Lord within the heart. ||28|| 1416 : 238 I make so many mistakes, there is no end or limit to them. 1416 : 239 O Lord, please be merciful and forgive me; I am a sinner, a great offender. 1416 : 240 O Dear Lord, if You made an account of my mistakes, my turn to be forgiven would not even come. Please forgive me, and unite me with Yourself. 1416 : 241 The Guru, in His Pleasure, has united me with the Lord God; He has cut away all my sinful mistakes. 1416 : 242 Servant Nanak celebrates the victory of those who meditate on the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||29|| 1416 : 243 Those who have been separated and alienated from the Lord are united with Him again, through the Fear and the Love of the True Guru. 1416 : 244 Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 007 32

They escape the cycle of birth and death, and, as Gurmukh, they meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1416 : 245 Joining the Saadh Sangat, the Guru's Congregation, the diamonds and jewels are obtained. 1416 : 246 O Nanak, the jewel is priceless; the Gurmukhs seek and find it. ||30|| 1416 : 247 The self−willed manmukhs do not even think of the Naam. Cursed are their lives, and cursed are their homes. 1416 : 248 That Lord who gives them so much to eat and wear − they do not enshrine that Lord, the Treasure of Virtue, in their minds. 1416 : 249 This mind is not pierced by the Word of the Shabad; how can it come to dwell in its true home? 1416 : 250 The self−willed manmukhs are like discarded brides, ruined by coming and going in the cycle of reincarnation. 1416 : 251 The Gurmukhs are embellished and exalted by the Naam, the Name of the Lord; the jewel of destiny is engraved upon their foreheads. 1416 : 252 They enshrine the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, within their hearts; the Lord illumines their heart−lotus. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 007 33

1416 : 253 I am forever a sacrifice to those who serve their True Guru. 1416 : 254 O Nanak, radiant and bright are the faces of those whose inner beings are illuminated with the Light of the Naam. ||31|| 1416 : 255 Those who die in the Word of the Shabad are saved. Without the Shabad, no one is liberated. 1416 : 256 They wear religious robes and perform all sorts of rituals, but they are ruined; in the love of duality, their world is ruined. 1416 : 257 O Nanak, without the True Guru, the Name is not obtained, even though one may long for it hundreds of times. ||32|| 1416 : 258 The Name of the Lord is utterly great, lofty and high, the highest of the high. 1416 : 259 No one can climb up to it, even though one may long for it, hundreds of times. 1416 : 260 Speaking about self−discipline, no one become pure; everyone walks around wearing religious robes. 1416 : 261 Those blessed by the karma of good deeds go and climb the ladder of the Guru. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 007 34
1416 : 262 The Lord comes and dwells within that one who contemplates the Word of the Guru's Shabad. −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 007 −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 007 35

Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 008 1417 : 263 O Nanak, when someone dies in the Word of the Shabad, the mind is pleased and appeased. True is the reputation of those who are true. ||33|| 1417 : 264 Emotional attachment to Maya is a treacherous ocean of pain and poison, which cannot be crossed. 1417 : 265 Screaming, "Mine, mine!", they rot and die; they pass their lives in egotism. 1417 : 266 The self−willed manmukhs are in limbo, neither on this side, nor the other; they are stuck in the middle. 1417 : 267 They act as they are pre−destined; they cannot do anything else. 1417 : 268 Following the Guru's Teachings, the jewel of spiritual wisdom abides in the mind, and then God is easily seen in all. 1417 : 269 O Nanak, the very fortunate ones embark on the Boat of the True Guru; they are carried across the terrifying world−ocean. ||34|| 1417 : 270 Without the True Guru, there is no giver who can bestow the Support of the Lord's Name. 36

1417 : 271 By Guru's Grace, the Name comes to dwell in the mind; keep it enshrined in your heart. 1417 : 272 The fire of desire is extinguished, and one finds satisfaction, through the Love of the Name of the Lord. 1417 : 273 O Nanak, the Gurmukh finds the Lord, when He showers His Mercy. ||35|| 1417 : 274 Without the Shabad, the world is so insane, that it cannot even be described. 1417 : 275 Those who are protected by the Lord are saved; they remain lovingly attuned to the Word of the Shabad. 1417 : 276 O Nanak, the Creator who made this making knows everything. ||36|| 1417 : 277 The Pandits, the religious scholars, have grown weary of making fire−offerings and sacrifices, making pilgrimages to all the sacred shrines, and reading the Puraanas. 1417 : 278 But they cannot get rid of the poison of emotional attachment to Maya; they continue to come and go in egotism. 1417 : 279 Meeting with the True Guru, one's filth is washed off, meditating on the Lord, the Primal Being, the All−knowing One. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 008 37

1417 : 280 Servant Nanak is forever a sacrifice to those who serve their Lord God. ||37|| 1417 : 281 Mortals give great thought to Maya and emotional attachment; they harbor great hopes, in greed and corruption. 1417 : 282 The self−willed manmukhs do not become steady and stable; they die and are gone in an instant. 1417 : 283 Only those who are blessed with great good fortune meet the True Guru, and leave behind their egotism and corruption. 1417 : 284 Chanting the Name of the Lord, they find peace; servant Nanak contemplates the Word of the Shabad. ||38|| 1417 : 285 Without the True Guru, there is no devotional worship, and no love of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1417 : 286 Servant Nanak worships and adores the Naam, with love and affection for the Guru. ||39|| 1417 : 287 Do not trust greedy people, if you can avoid doing so. 1417 : 288 At the very last moment, they will deceive you there, where no one will be able to lend a helping hand. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 008 38

By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1425 : 550 They alone are imbued with the Lord, who do not turn their faces away from Him − they realize Him. 1425 : 551 The false, immature lovers do not know the way of love, and so they fall. ||1|| 1425 : 552 Without my Master, I will burn my silk and satin clothes in the fire. 1425 : 553 Even rolling in the dust, I look beautiful, O Nanak, if my Husband Lord is with me. ||2|| 1425 : 554 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, I worship and adore the Naam, with love and balanced detachment. 1425 : 555 When the five enemies are overcome, O Nanak, this musical measure of Raga MAAROO becomes frtuiful. ||3|| 1425 : 556 73

When I have the One Lord, I have tens of thousands. Otherwise, people like me beg from door to door. 1425 : 557 O Brahmin, your life has passed away uselessly; you have forgotten the One who created you. ||4|| 1425 : 558 In Raga Sorat'h, drink in this sublime essence, which never loses its taste. 1425 : 559 O Nanak, singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name, one's reputation is immaculate in the Court of the Lord. ||5|| 1425 : 560 No one can kill those whom God Himself protects. 1425 : 561 The treasure of the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is within them. They cherish His Glorious Virtues forever. 1425 : 562 They take the Support of the One, the Inaccessible Lord; they enshrine God in their mind and body. 1425 : 563 They are imbued with the Love of the Infinite Lord, and no one can wipe it away. 1425 : 564 The Gurmukhs sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord; they obtain the most excellent celestial peace and poise. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 016 74

1425 : 565 O Nanak, they enshrine the treasure of the Naam in their hearts. ||6|| 1425 : 566 Whatever God does, accept that as good; leave behind all other judgements. 1425 : 567 He shall cast His Glance of Grace, and attach you to Himself. 1425 : 568 Instruct yourself with the Teachings, and doubt will depart from within. 1425 : 569 Everyone does that which is pre−ordained by destiny. 1425 : 570 Everything is under His control; there is no other place at all. 1425 : 571 Nanak is in peace and bliss, accepting the Will of God. ||7|| 1425 : 572 Those who meditate in remembrance on the Perfect Guru, are exalted and uplifted. 1425 : 573 O Nanak, dwelling on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, all affairs are resolved. ||8|| 1425 : 574 The sinners act, and generate bad karma, and then they weep and wail. Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 016 75

1425 : 575 O Nanak, just as the churning stick churns the butter, so does the Righteous Judge of Dharma churn them. ||9|| 1425 : 576 Meditating on the Naam, O friend, the treasure of life is won. 1425 : 577 O Nanak, speaking in Righteousness, one's world becomes sanctified. ||10|| 1425 : 578 I am stuck in an evil place, trusting the sweet words of an evil advisor. 1425 : 579 O Nanak, they alone are saved, who have such good destiny inscribed upon their foreheads. ||11|| 1425 : 580 They alone sleep and dream in peace, who are imbued with the Love of their Husband Lord. 1425 : 581 Those who have been separated from the Love of their Master, scream and cry twenty−four hours a day. ||12|| 1425 : 582 Millions are asleep, in the false illusion of Maya. 1425 : 583 O Nanak, they alone are awake and aware, who chant the Naam with their tongues. ||13|| Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 016 76

1425 : 584 Seeing the mirage, the optical illusion, the people are confused and deluded. 1425 : 585 Those who worship and adore the True Lord, O Nanak, their minds and bodies are beautiful. ||14|| 1425 : 586 The All−powerful Supreme Lord God, the Infinite Primal Being, is the Saving Grace of sinners. −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars −− Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars − Part 016 77
